intro: Thesium pycnanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellowish or greenish flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Thesium pycnanthum is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
